docs.snippet: The common people of the world still retain their faith in the realization of the promises of the United Nations Charter "in spite of the strident forensic fury" of current United Nations meetings, General Assembly delegates from thirty-eight...
docs.lead_paragraph: The common people of the world still retain their faith in the realization of the promises of the United Nations Charter "in spite of the strident forensic fury" of current United Nations meetings, General Assembly delegates from thirty-eight countries were told yesterday at a solemn high mass celebrated in St. Patrick's Cathedral for the success of the Assembly's session here.
docs.abstract: delegates attend special Mass, St Patrick's Cathedral; illus

headline.main: FAITH IN U.N. ACTIOH EXPRESSED AT MASS; Assembly Delegations From 38 Countries Present at Special Service at St. Patrick's

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 23 -- With investors having little incentive to buy in the face of the uncertainties of Britain's export business and the possibility of a fall budget, business in stock markets here today was on a small scale. Industrials opened firm...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 23 -- With investors having little incentive to buy in the face of the uncertainties of Britain's export business and the possibility of a fall budget, business in stock markets here today was on a small scale. Industrials opened firm but owing to lack of business prices fell away at the close.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Trade Restricted by Outlook for Exports -- Prices Ease -- Gilt-Edges Steady

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS. N.Y. Sept. 25 -- The powerful Latin-American bloc agreed today to support Canada's election to the United Nations Security Council -- virtually assuring the Dominion of a seat -- and tentatively decided to back Argentina for a second of...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS. N.Y. Sept. 25 -- The powerful Latin-American bloc agreed today to support Canada's election to the United Nations Security Council -- virtually assuring the Dominion of a seat -- and tentatively decided to back Argentina for a second of three vacancies.
docs.abstract: Assembly behind-the-scenes selections of candidates for 6 vacant posts noted

headline.main: CANADA, ARGENTINA BACKED FOR COUNCIL; Latins to Vote for Dominion for Security Body -- Tentative Support for Other Nation U.S. FOR RELUCTANT CZECHS Three Vacancies in the Board to Be Filled -- Six to Be Named to Economic Unit

byline.original: By A.M. ROSENTHALSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: H. Ross Colwell, regional director of the United States Conciliation Service, announced yesterday that representatives of United States Steel's Federal Shipyard and the Industrial Union of Marine and Shipbuilding Workers of America, CIO, would meet...
docs.lead_paragraph: H. Ross Colwell, regional director of the United States Conciliation Service, announced yesterday that representatives of United States Steel's Federal Shipyard and the Industrial Union of Marine and Shipbuilding Workers of America, CIO, would meet at his office Tuesday in a renewed effort to settle the thirteen-week-old strike affecting shipyards on the East and Gulf Coast.
docs.abstract: US conciliator sets Fed Shipyd-IUMSWA conf; grievances noted; Bethlehem confs continue

headline.main: New Effort to Settle the Shipyard Strike To Be Made on Tuesday in Capital Parley

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 26. -- Under the lead of good dividends, together with large buying orders, the stock markets here today continued cheerful.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 26. -- Under the lead of good dividends, together with large buying orders, the stock markets here today continued cheerful.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Declarations of Dividends and General Increase in Buying Orders Raise Prices

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Sept. 27 -- The United States and Britain have decided to support Argentina for a place in the United Nations Security Council, it was learned today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Sept. 27 -- The United States and Britain have decided to support Argentina for a place in the United Nations Security Council, it was learned today.
docs.abstract: US and GB to support Argentina; USSR opposition seen; US-Brit bloc support of Canada and Czechoslovakia seen

docs.snippet: Business in the foreign exchange market last week settled in the pattern of its predecessors -- chief interest centering in the pound sterling, Canadian and Swiss free currencies. All other descriptions were lightly traded at no important price...
docs.lead_paragraph: Business in the foreign exchange market last week settled in the pattern of its predecessors -- chief interest centering in the pound sterling, Canadian and Swiss free currencies. All other descriptions were lightly traded at no important price change.

headline.main: Son to Mrs. Robert D. Barton

docs.snippet: United States support of Argentina's bid for a place on the Security Council is in line with Hemisphere policy, which is the rule of the majority. A majority of the Latin-American countries wanted Argentina to fill the seat being vacated by Brazil....
docs.lead_paragraph: United States support of Argentina's bid for a place on the Security Council is in line with Hemisphere policy, which is the rule of the majority. A majority of the Latin-American countries wanted Argentina to fill the seat being vacated by Brazil. The United States is going along.
docs.abstract: ed, backs US support of Argentina
